name: 楊元森
objective: This course introduces the theory and applications of numerical approximation techniques, including preliminary error analysis, solutions of equations, approximation, differential equations, linear algebra, and optimization. It is designed for undergraduate engineering majors who have completed at least the first year of the standard college calculus sequence.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to Numerical Analysis  
Week 2: Off
Week 3: Preliminary Engineering Analysis
Week 4: Solutions of Equations in One Variable (1): Bisection
Week 5: Solutions of Equations in One Variable (2)
Week 6: Solutions of Equations in One Variable (3)
Week 7: Off
Week 8: Ordinary Differential Equations (1)
Week 9: Ordinary Differential Equations (2)
Week 10: Midterm
Week 11: Midterm Review 
Week 12: Preliminary Matrices and Vectors
Week 13: Direct Methods for Solving Linear Systems (1)
Week 14: Direct Methods for Solving Linear Systems (2)
Week 15: Iterative Techniques in Matrix Algebra
Week 16: Basic Finite Element Method
Week 17: Final Project Presentations (1)
Week 18: Final Project Presentations (2)
scorePolicy:
Class performance (quiz, activities, discussions): 20% (+/- 5%)
Midterm: 30% (+/- 10%)
Final Project: 50% (+/- 10%)
materials: 數值分析 第九版 (Burden, Faires) (江大成 譯) (Burden, Faires (2010) Numerical Analysis 9/E.) (ISBN 978-986-6121-16-6) (平裝附光碟)
